parameters.name: CommandID
parameters.description: Command's ID or PropertyManager page's command ID as defined in swCommands_e

parameters.name: IsUiActive
parameters.description: True if command or PropertyManager page is active in the user-interface, false if not

title: ISldWorks.GetRunningCommandInfo
description: Get a command's ID or PropertyManager page's command ID, title, and whether it is active in the user-interface.
signature:
void GetRunningCommandInfo( 
   out System.Int32
CommandID
,
   out System.String
PMTitle
,
   out System.Boolean
IsUiActive
)

parameters.name: CommandID
parameters.description: Command's ID or PropertyManager page's command ID as defined in swCommands_e

parameters.name: IsUiActive
parameters.description: True if command or PropertyManager page is active in the user-interface, false if not

remarks: Before using this method, you must add a reference to the SOLIDWORKS commands type library or DLL to access the SOLIDWORKS commands.
